articles.title: Senior Officials of C.C., WPK Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Senior Officials of C.C., WPK Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Senior officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay homage to leader Kim Jong Il at 00:00 of Sunday, the 6th anniversary of his demise.
					 They included Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, and Pak Kwang Ho, Ri Su Yong, Kim Phyong Hae, Thae Jong Su, O Su Yong, An Jong Su, Pak Thae Song, Kim Yong Chol, Choe Hui and Pak Thae Dok, vice-chairmen of the C.C., WPK.
					
					 Laid before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were a floral basket in the name of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the SAC of the DPRK.
					
					 The visitors paid high tribute to the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They made deep bows to Kim Jong Il in the hall where he lies in state.

articles.title: Senior State and Army Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Senior State and Army Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Senior state and army officials of the DPRK visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday, the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Among them were Kim Yong Nam, Presidium member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly; Pak Pong Ju, Presidium member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and premier of the Cabinet; and other senior state and army officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, members of the party central leadership organ here and officials of armed forces organs, ministries and national institutions
					
					 Seen standing before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il were a floral basket in the name of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Placed at the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the SPA Presidium of the DPRK, the Cabinet of the DPRK and the KPA.
					
					 Senior state and army officials paid homage to the statues.
					
					 The visitors made deep bows to Kim Jong Il in the hall of immortality where he lies in state.
					
					 That day servicepersons and civilians from all walks of life also visited the palace to pay homage to Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Korean Revolution Museum
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials of the DPRK and officials of the ministries and national institutions visited the Korean Revolution Museum on Sunday, the 6th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise.
					 They were briefed on the fact that he performed undying revolutionary feats, which will long shine in the history of the country, continuing to make high-intensity forced march for the prosperity of Juche Korea and the happiness of the people.
					
					 They also watched the video of the field guidance given by him to every nook and corner of the country with his train as office room and home even in the days of Juche 100 (2011), the last year of his great revolutionary career, which made them look back with deep emotion upon his devotion and efforts.
					
					 They paid tribute to the color statue of Kim Jong Il standing on Chol Pass symbolic of the leadership of Songun revolution in a padded jacket at the hall of arduous and forced marches.
					
					 They watched for a long while the pictures and relics of Kim Jong Il arousing the service members and people at the hill of tears of blood and visiting Height 351, the Cho Islet Defence Detachment, the construction site of the Anbyon Youth Power Station etc in order to reliably defend socialism and pave a broad avenue to the building of a thriving country.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their smiling portraits across the country on the occasion of the greatest memorial day of the nation.
					 Seen before the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill here was a basket of flowers from respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Placed at the statues were floral baskets in the names of party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and institutions at all levels, industrial establishments and schools in Pyongyang.
					
					 Also laid was a floral basket in the name of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					 Meanwhile, floral baskets in the names of KPA and KPISF units and institutions and industrial establishments were placed at the statues of the great leaders in different parts of the city including Kim Il Sung University, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security and the Mansudae Art Studio.
					
					 Servicepersons, working citizens and school youths and children in different parts of the country paid floral tribute to the statues of the great leaders and their smiling portraits in their residential areas.

articles.title: Korean People Mourn Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Korean People Mourn Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK mourned leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the sixth anniversary of his demise.
					 On the greatest memorial day of the nation, many servicepersons and civilians visited the plaza of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun, the supreme temple of Juche, to pay tribute to the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Servicepersons, working people from all walks of life and school youth and children paid homage to the statues of the great leaders and their smiling portraits across the country including the statues on Mansu Hill.
					
					 A remembrance concert "The General Is Immortal as the Sun" was given at the Moranbong Theatre by the National Symphony Orchestra.
					
					 Similar concerts were also hosted in different parts of the country including North and South Phyongan, Jagang, North Hamgyong, Kangwon and Ryanggang provinces.
					
					 Working people's organizations across the country held oath-taking meetings.

articles.title: Foreigners, Compatriots Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Foreigners, Compatriots Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Foreigners and overseas Koreans visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday, the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Among the foreigners were diplomatic envoys and military attaches of embassies of different countries, representatives of the missions of international organizations here and a delegation of the Japanese Women's Society for the Study of the Juche Idea to learn from Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The visitors paid tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 In the hall of immortality where Kim Jong Il lies in state, they made deep bows to him.
					
					 They went round the rooms where orders the great leaders received are on display and rooms that house car, electric car, boat and train coach used by him for field guidance and foreign tour till the last moments of his life.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Feats Will Be Glorified: DPRK Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Feats Will Be Glorified: DPRK Papers
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK's leading newspapers Sunday devote editorials to the sixth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Rodong Sinmun in an editorial says that his august name as the sun has been the symbol of mightiness and dignity of Juche Korea and the history of his revolutionary activities a textbook of life and struggle for the Korean people and his behests and exploits have served as the driving force for achieving epoch-making miracles in defending socialism and building a thriving country.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 With firm confidence in the victory of the socialist cause of Juche pioneered in Mt Paektu, he had wisely guided the revolution and construction under the ever-changing whirlpool of the 20th and 21st centuries with his outstanding idea and rare leadership.
					
					 He indicated the path of achieving the victory of socialism with his brilliant wisdom that no other great man can follow in the world. His ideas and theories serve as guidelines giving the confidence in victory and encouragement to the world's revolutionary peoples struggling for socialism.
					
					 The powerful political and military muscle built and cemented by him throughout his whole life is the best national power and the strongest weapon of socialist Korea.
					
					 He unfolded a grand blueprint for prosperity of the country for the first time in its history and wisely led the struggle to put it into practice.
					
					 His feats will be immortal as he provided an eternal foundation for building the best power which is always thriving with powerful national strength and where the people enjoy a happy life to the full with no more to desire in the world.
					
					 Minju Joson in an editorial says that the Korean people will convey through generations the feats of Kim Jong Il who guaranteed the eternal future of socialist Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slashes at S. Korean Chief Executive's Foreign Trip
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slashes at S. Korean Chief Executive's Foreign Trip
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive visited China from Dec. 13 to 16. In this regard, the puppet regime talked about "discussion for solving the nuclear issue and achieving peace" and "request for stop".
					 Rodong Sinmun in a commentary on Sunday terms his trip a worthless trip of a beggar trying to get rid of the international isolation caused by his policy of toeing the U.S. line and a trip for escalating confrontation with the fellow countrymen through strengthened cooperation with the foreign forces in the anti-DPRK sanction and pressure racket.
					
					 The commentary says:
					
					 The south Korean chief executive was so shameless as to describe it as an effort for peace of the Korean peninsula and the region to screw up sanctions on the DPRK.
					
					 Dependence on outsiders and sycophantic treachery will only bring humiliation and disgrace.
					
					 The puppet regime should be mindful that its crazy moves for dependence on outsiders and confrontation with the fellow countrymen will only plunge it deeper into international isolation and crisis of its own destruction.

articles.title: Ships Collide in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ships Collide in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Ships collided with each other in a wharf of Pusan Port, south Korea on Dec. 11, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 A large container ship returning to the wharf struck another large cargo ship which was discharging.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Koreans in China
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the General Association of Koreans in China on Sunday, the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The letter noted that Kim Jong Il conducted his energetic external activities for the victory in the cause of socialism, the world peace and stability and friendship and solidarity among the peoples under the uplifted banner of independence against imperialism and thus put the DPRK's international prestige on the highest level and made contributions to the human cause of independence.
					
					 He had always taken warm care of the work and life of Korean nationals in China during the whole period of his great life and highly appreciated and glorified their due and minor deeds, it said.
					
					 It stressed that he is always alive in the mind of the Korean nation and his revolutionary history is given a steady continuity thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un, the peerlessly illustrious commander and general of Mt Paektu.
					
					 Noting that Kim Jong Un turned the DPRK into the strongest nuclear weapons state and rocket power, which no formidable enemy can dare to provoke, by translating Kim Jong Il's patriotic desire for the building of a power into a brilliant reality with the mettle and pluck of Mt Paektu and through his tireless efforts and devotion and thus provided a sure guarantee for the eternal prosperity of the nation, the letter said that his exploits would remain in the nation's history forever.
					
					 It stressed that the august name and tender-hearted image of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il would always be kept in the minds of the Korean nation and his history of revolutionary activities and exploits would shine long in the nation's history.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Introduced in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Reminiscences Introduced in Germany
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted the full text of "9. Nurturing the Root of the Revolution" from "Chapter 23 In Alliance with the International Anti-Imperialist Forces" of Vol. 8 (Continuing Edition) of Part 1 The Anti-Japanese Revolution of "With the Century", the reminiscences of President Kim Il Sung, on its website on Dec. 12 to commemorate the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Events Held Abroad to Commemorate Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Events Held Abroad to Commemorate Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries to commemorate the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 There were a Korean book, photo, stamp and handicraft exhibition, a remembrance concert and a film show in Russia, round-table talks in Indonesia and Ethiopia and a lecture meeting in Mexico between Nov. 26 and Dec. 5.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also there were their works and books and photos introducing the true picture of socialist Korea.
					
					 Oleg Revedev, deputy to the State Duma of Russia, said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into an invincible power which no formidable enemy can dare to provoke, adding that the reality proves that only the powerful military force can ensure safety and peace of a country.
					
					 V. P. Isakov, first secretary of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation, stressed that Kim Jong Il is always alive in the hearts of the Korean and Russian peoples for his gigantic contributions to the prosperity of Korea and development of the Russia-DPRK relations.
					
					 Nurdin Purnomo, chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia, said that the revolutionary career of HE Kim Jong Il, who had devoted his all to the country's prosperity and the people's happiness, would shine long with the century.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, praised Kim Jong Il's immortal Songun revolutionary leadership exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Foreign Organizations
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Organizations of different countries posted on their websites special write-ups under such titles as "Person who believed in the people as in Heaven" between Nov. 17 and Dec. 12 to commemorate the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of Songun Politics posted an article illustrated with an art work depicting Kim Jong Il, which said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il, leader of the DPRK, regarded it as his motto to believe in the people as in Heaven.
					
					 He gave a top priority to the conveniences of the people and disallowed any slight act going against it.
					
					 That's why the Korean people have heartily uphold and deeply revered him who loved them and dedicated his all to them.
					
					 His dignified image as their tender-hearted father will be kept in their hearts forever.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted the following article:
					
					 The reality of the DPRK pushing ahead with the building of a socialist power under the banner of Songun despite all sorts of hardships would have been unthinkable without the feats of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He formulated the Songun politics as the basic political mode under socialism and strengthened the Korean People's Army into the invincible revolutionary armed forces through his ceaseless military inspection.
					
					 His cause of Songun is being steadily carried forward.
					
					 The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo posted an article introducing Kim Jong Il's outlook on the people characterized by warm love and trust in them.

articles.title: DPRK's Major Holidays in December Observed by DR Congolese Figure
articles.content:
DPRK's Major Holidays in December Observed by DR Congolese Figure
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Boswa Isekombe Sylvere, general secretary of the Communist Party of the DR Congo, issued a statement on Nov. 28 to mark the 26th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the Supreme Commandership of the Korean People's Army, the 6th anniversary of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's assumption of the KPA Supreme Commandership and the 100th birth anniversary of the anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Generalissimo Kim Jong Il pursued the Songun politics in an overall way at the end of the last century when socialist Korea met the worst trial, and strengthened the KPA into an invincible army through his ceaseless military inspection.
					
					 His Songun leadership exploits will shine long with prosperity of the DPRK.
					
					 History knows many women famed for their contributions to the progress and prosperity of their countries and nations, but there has been no prominent political activist like Kim Jong Suk, revered by the Korean people as the anti-Japanese war heroine, who dedicated her all to the people's freedom and happiness.
					
					 We pay high tribute to her who made immortal contributions to Korea's liberation and building of a new country.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un, who is creditably carrying forward the revolutionary cause of the preceding leaders, has firmly defended peace and stability of the Korean peninsula and the rest of the world, resolutely smashing every challenge of the U.S. and other hostile forces.
					
					 He made sure that a fresh line of simultaneously developing the two fronts has been invariably implemented and thus brought about a radical turn in the DPRK's strategic position and enhanced the country's political and military might in every way.
					
					 That's why all the Korean people are upholding his leadership in a single mind, absolutely trusting and following him.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Remembered in Britain
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Remembered in Britain
 Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, Korean Friendship Association UK and the British Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification of the Korean Peninsula issued a joint statement on Dec. 7 to observe the 6th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The statement said that Kim Jong Il's demise was the great sorrow to the Korean people and the world's progressives and that yearning for him is growing stronger among the world people with passage of time.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Il performed tremendous exploits in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields with his distinguished leadership ability.
					
					 He was the leader of the people who developed the DPRK's socialism on the basis of the Juche idea, the Songun idea and the great successor to the revolutionary cause of Comrade Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He consolidated the integral whole of the leader, the Party and the masses as firm as rock and dynamically led the Workers' Party of Korea only along the road of Juche.
					
					 Thanks to his Songun politics, the DPRK could win victory after victory in the acute showdown with the imperialists and emerge a full-fledged nuclear weapons state.
					
					 We are remembering him with deep emotion on the threshold of the 6th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Cuadros del CC del PTC rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Cuadros del CC del PTC rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En ocasion del VI aniversario de deceso del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, los cuadros directivos del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea visitaron a la hora 0 del dia 17 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Estuvieron presentes en la ceremonia de homenaje Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, y los vicepresidentes del CC del PTC, Pak Kwang Ho, Ri Su Yong, Kim Phyong Hae, Thae Jong Su, O Su Yong, An Jong Su, Pak Thae Song, Kim Yong Chol, Choe Hwi y Pak Thae Dok.
					
					Estaban colocados al pie de las estatuas de pie del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il un cesto de flores en nombre del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un y otro a nombre comun del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el CE de la RPDC.
					
					Los visitantes rindieron el homenaje postumo al Presidente y al Dirigente ante sus estatuas de pie.
					
					Y expresaron tributo a Kim Jong Il en el salon de eternidad donde esta conservado su cuerpo.

articles.title: Cuadros del Estado y Ejercito rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Cuadros del Estado y Ejercito rinden tributo a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il en Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del aniversario 6 del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, los cuadros directivos del Estado y el Ejercito visitaron el dia 17 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					Entre los visitantes figuraban Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del BP del CC del PTC, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y otros cuadros directivos del Estado y el Ejercito, el presidente de partido amigo, los miembros del organo de direccion central del partido en esta capital y los funcionarios de organismos de fuerzas armadas, ministerios y organos centrales.
					
					Ante las estatuas de pie de los grandes Lideres Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, estaban colocados el cesto de flores en nombre del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un y otro en nombre comun del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el CE de la RPDC.
					
					Quedo depositado el cesto de flores a nombre comun del Presidium de la APS y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y el Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					Los cuadros directivos del Estado y el ejercito rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de pie.
					
					Los visitantes hicieron lo mismo al Dirigente en el salon de eternidad donde esta conservado su cuerpo.
					
					El mismo dia, hicieron otro tanto los oficiales y soldados del EPC y los trabajadores de distintos estratos.

articles.title: Cuadros coreanos visitan el Museo de la Revolucion Coreana
articles.content:
Cuadros coreanos visitan el Museo de la Revolucion Coreana
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 6o aniversario del fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, los cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado y los funcionarios de los ministerios y los organos centrales visitaron el dia 17 el Museo de la Revolucion Coreana.
					Ellos escucharon explicaciones de que el Dirigente acumulo las imperecederas hazanas revolucionarias a registrarse en los anales de la paria, siempre estando en la marcha forzada y superdura para la prosperidad de la Corea Juche y la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					Vieron un video que hace recordar los esfuerzos fisicos y mentales del Dirigente quien hasta el 100 (2011) de la Era Juche, ultimo ano de su vida revolucionaria, dejo imborrables huellas de direccion en todas partes de la patria, tomando el vagon de tren como su oficina y residencia.
					
					En la sala del periodo de la Marcha Penosa y la forzada, le rindieron el postumo homenaje ante la estatua en color del Dirigente con abrigo de campana, estando en el monte Chol, simbolo de la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun.
					
					Los visitantes pasaron revista tambien a las fotos del Dirigente y los objetos historicos que transmiten la vida del gran hombre sin igual quien estimulo a todos los militares y habitantes entristecidos por el deceso del Presidente Kim Il Sung, defendio el socialismo visitando la cota 351, la unidad de defensa de la isla Cho y el campo de construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica Juventud de Anbyon y abrio el ancho camino de la construccion de la patria prospera.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena la visita a China del mandatario surcoreano
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena la visita a China del mandatario surcoreano
Pyongyang, 17 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En cuanto a la visita a China del gobernante surcoreano realizada del dia 13 al 16, los titeres surcoreanos dicen que hubo el "debate de remedios para el problema nuclear y la paz" y la "peticion sobre la suspension". 
					En una palabra, esa visita fue la del mendigo que pretendio salir del aislamiento en la arena internacional, causado por el servilismo desmesurado a EE.UU.
					
					Condena asi un comentario individual divulgado hoy en el rotativo Rodong Sinmun y continua:
					
					Igualmente, persiguio el objetivo criminal y fratricida de intensificar la cooperacion con las fuerzas extranjeras en sancionar y presionar a la connacional RPDC.
					
					El mandatario surcoreano describio cinicamente el recrudecimiento de la sancion anti-RPDC como una medida para la paz en la Peninsula Coreana y la region.
					
					La dependencia de las fuerzas extranjeras y el acto traidor a la patria no daran otro resultado que la humillacion y verguenza.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos deben tener presente que si siguen portandose como ahora, seran aislados mas en el ambito exterior y arruinados de la peor manera.
